snippet: New rules from Hewlett-Packard, one of the world’s largest makers of computers and other tech products, reflect a major shift in how electronics companies view Chinese labor practices.
abstract: Hewlett-Packard is imposing new limits on employment of students and temporary agency workers at factories across China; move, following recent efforts by Apple to increase scrutiny of student workers, reflects significant shift in how electronics companies view problematic labor practices in China.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and DAVID BARBOZA
byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher reported from Hong Kong and David Barboza from Shanghai. Xu Yan contributed research from Shanghai.

lead_paragraph: New rules from Hewlett-Packard, one of the world’s largest makers of computers and other tech products, reflect a major shift in how electronics companies view Chinese labor practices.

headline.seo: Hewlett-Packard Joins Push to Limit Use of Student Labor in China
headline.main: H.P. Directs Its Suppliers in China to Limit Student Labor
headline.print_headline: Hewlett Pushes China to Limit Student Labor
